Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the MoMoM DB esists which removes and inputs all known notarisations. this DB could be used to create payments. But I'm not really surre how to go abnout doing that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it follows reorgs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: unlike dpow

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: which cant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: say you refer to 3 past notarizations in the notary tx. in the block that it happens if any of the 3 notarizations are valid, the payout is made

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now it can be validated based on the single block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is protected by the 3 deep referred notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: chaintip needs to have all 3 being valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: during initialization only 1 of the 3 being valid is enough

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe the different behavior during init is the key?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
its not really init .. its only a fresh sync... because of reorgs happening every 2-3 blocks when this attack is happening... the checkpoints are not created on a fresh sync in the same order as they are live.... 
The only solution to this I could see was to not use notarizxation check points... You can only referance the tx in the chain itself... Its like amost impossivble to know which notarisation protects which tx when your under this attack

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each block can easily referance tx inside it with 100% accuracy during this attack

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: any other solution seems like it could be broken

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: however unlikely
